title: Russian strikes on Ukraine kill over 20
subhead: Air strikes targeted the Dnipropetrovsk and Zaporizhia regions, where a prison colony was bombed 'deliberately,' according to the Ukrainian president. The death toll involving all the strikes stands at 27, with 85 wounded.

title: Thailand accuses Cambodia of violating ceasefire, Phnom Penh denies any firing
subhead: An 'immediate and unconditional' ceasefire agreement had come into effect a few hours earlier on Monday, after five days of deadly clashes.

title: 'Half the city lay in ruins': Hanns Zischler, the cultural memory of West Berlin
subhead: 'Being 20 in West Berlin' (1/6). The actor, writer, translator, and photographer, a figure of Germany's artistic and intellectual scene, arrived in the walled-in city in the early 1970s. He never left, drawn by a vibrancy that set West Berlin apart from the rest of the Federal Republic of Germany at the time.

title: Nika Lozovska, chef: 'I work in a London restaurant called Brat. In Ukrainian, that means brother'
subhead: 'Refugee Recipes' (2/6). After training in Paris, Chef Nika Lozovska opened her restaurant, Dizyngoff, in the Black Sea city of Odesa in 2015. She fled the war in Ukraine and settled in London, where she keeps the memory of her hometown alive through a heirloom tomato and samphire salad.

title: K-pop boy band Stray Kids light up Paris with well-oiled show and adoring fans
subhead: The South Korean group performed two concerts at the Stade de France on July 26 and 27, for the French leg of their Dominate World Tour.

title: France's Gergovie plateau continues to reveal its ancient secrets
subhead: After four years exploring the depths of this archeological site in central France, archeologists have begun to draw their first conclusions, particularly regarding the so-called 'craftsmen's quarter.' This is the fourth excavation campaign at Gergovie since 1861, a site that once hosted the capital of the Arverni people.
